summary.para: The GetActualDataLength method retrieves the length of the valid data in the buffer.

returns.para: Returns the length of the valid data, in bytes.

summary.para: The GetMediaTime method retrieves the media times for this sample.

param.name: pTimeStart
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives the media start time.

param.name: pTimeEnd
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives the media stop time.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include those shown in the following table.

description.para: Media times are not set on this sample.

remarks.para: For more information about media times, see Time and Clocks in DirectShow.

summary.para: The GetMediaType method retrieves the media type, if the media type differs from the previous sample.

param.name: ppMediaType
param.para: Address of a variable that receives a pointer to an structure. If the media type has not changed from the previous sample, *ppMediaType is set to NULL.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include those shown in the following table.

description.para: The media type has not changed from the previous sample.

remarks.para: This method enables a filter to make limited changes to the media type, such as changing the palette. To make a significant change to the media type, the pins might need to reconnect and renegotiate the media type.
If the method returns S_OK, the caller must free the memory for the media type, including the format block. You can use the DeleteMediaType function in the DirectShow base class library.

summary.para: The GetPointer method retrieves a read/write pointer to the media sample's buffer.

param.name: ppBuffer
param.para: Receives a pointer to the buffer.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful, or an HRESULT value indicating the cause of the error.

remarks.para: The buffer memory is owned by the media sample object, and is automatically released when the media sample is destroyed. The caller should not free or reallocate the buffer.

summary.para: The GetSize method retrieves the size of the buffer.

returns.para: Returns the size of the buffer, in bytes. The size does not include the prefix bytes, if any.

summary.para: The GetTime method retrieves the stream times at which this sample should begin and finish.

param.name: pTimeStart
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives the start time.

param.name: pTimeEnd
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives the stop time. If the sample has no stop time, the value is set to the start time plus one.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include those shown in the following table.

description.para: Success. The sample has valid start and stop times.
The sample has a valid start time, but no stop time.

remarks.para: Both time values are relative to the stream time. For more information, see Time and Clocks in DirectShow.

summary.para: The IsDiscontinuity method determines if this sample represents a break in the data stream.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if the sample is a break in the data stream. Otherwise, returns S_FALSE.

remarks.para: A discontinuity occurs when a filter seeks to a different place in the stream, or when a filter drops samples for quality control.

summary.para: The IsPreroll method determines if this sample is a preroll sample. A preroll sample should not be displayed.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if the sample is a preroll sample. Otherwise, returns S_FALSE.

remarks.para: Preroll samples are processed but not displayed. They are located in the media stream before the displayable samples.

summary.para: The IsSyncPoint method determines if the beginning of this sample is a synchronization point.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if the sample is a synchronization point. Otherwise, returns S_FALSE.

remarks.para: A filter can begin a stream at any synchronization point. With some compression types, streaming can begin only at certain points in the stream; for example, on key frames. If the bTemporalCompression member of the structure is FALSE, all samples are synchronization points.

summary.para: The SetActualDataLength method sets the length of the valid data in the buffer.

param.name: __MIDL__IMediaSample0000
param.para: Length of the data in the media sample, in bytes.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include those shown in the following table.

description.para: Length specified in lLen is larger than the buffer size.

summary.para: The SetDiscontinuity method specifies whether this sample represents a break in the data stream.

param.name: bDiscontinuity
param.para: Boolean value that specifies whether this sample is a discontinuity. If TRUE, the media sample is discontinuous with the previous sample.

returns.para: Returns S_OK, or an HRESULT value indicating the cause of the error.

summary.para: The SetMediaTime method sets the media times for this sample.

param.name: pTimeStart
param.para: Pointer to the beginning media time.

param.name: pTimeEnd
param.para: Pointer to the ending media time.

returns.para: Returns S_OK, or an HRESULT value indicating the cause of the error.

remarks.para: To invalidate the media time, set pTimeStart and pTimeEnd to NULL. This will cause the method to return VFW_E_MEDIA_TIME_NOT_SET.
For more information about media times, see Time Stamps.

summary.para: The SetMediaType method sets the media type for the sample.

param.name: pMediaType
param.para: Pointer to an structure that specifies the media type.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include those shown in the following table.

remarks.para: By default, every sample has the same media type as the previous sample. (The pin connection determines the original media type.) Call this method to make limited changes to the media type, such as changing the palette. To make a significant change to the media type, the pins might need to reconnect and renegotiate the media type.

summary.para: The SetPreroll method specifies whether this sample is a preroll sample.

param.name: bIsPreroll
param.para: Boolean value that specifies whether this is a preroll sample. If TRUE, this is a preroll sample.

returns.para: Returns S_OK, or an HRESULT value indicating the cause of the error.

summary.para: The SetSyncPoint method specifies whether the beginning of this sample is a synchronization point.

param.name: bIsSyncPoint
param.para: Boolean value that specifies whether this is a synchronization point. If TRUE, this is a synchronization point.

returns.para: Returns S_OK or an HRESULT value indicating the cause of the error.

remarks.para: The filter that first generates the data in the sample should set this flag to TRUE or FALSE, as appropriate. For uncompressed video and PCM audio, set every sample to TRUE. For compressed video, set key frames to TRUE and delta frames to FALSE.
This flag is purely informational. Other filters downstream might check this flag; for example, a filter might need to skip to the next key frame.

summary.para: The SetTime method sets the stream times when this sample should begin and finish.

param.name: pTimeStart
param.para: Pointer to a variable that contains the start time of the sample.

param.name: pTimeEnd
param.para: Pointer to a variable that contains the stop time of the sample.

returns.para: Returns S_OK, or HRESULT value indicating the cause of the error.

remarks.para: Both time values are relative to the stream time. For more information, see Time and Clocks in DirectShow.
To invalidate the stream times, set pTimeStart and pTimeEnd to NULL. This will cause the method to return VFW_E_SAMPLE_TIME_NOT_SET.
For more information about stream times, see Time and Clocks in DirectShow.

summary.para: The IMediaSample interface sets and retrieves properties on media samples. A media sample is a COM object that contains a block of media data. Media samples support the use of shared memory buffers among filters.

Typically, applications do not call methods on this interface. Filters use this interface to set properties on samples, and deliver the samples to a downstream filter. The downstream filter uses the interface to retrieve the properties and read the data. The filter can modify the data in place, or it can copy the sample, modify the copy, and pass the copy downstream.
